author: Beth Haines
title: Can I track GPS without internet?
text:
Can I track GPS without internet?
Yes, it is possible to track GPS without an internet connection. GPS tracking on your mobile device can work even without internet connectivity or a cellular service. As long as you have a charged smartphone with you, you can use GPS to find your way around remote areas and foreign landscapes.
How can I track my GPS offline?
To track your GPS offline, follow these steps:
1. Download a map to use offline: On your Android phone or tablet, open the Google Maps app. Make sure you’re connected to the internet and signed in to Google Maps. Search for a place, like San Francisco. At the bottom, tap the name or address of the place and tap “More Download offline map”.
Does GPS work if the phone is off?
No, GPS does not work if the phone is off. When you turn off your phone, you deactivate all of its functions, including wireless communication. GPS tracking relies on the phone’s ability to communicate with satellites and provide location information.
Can I use an old phone as a GPS tracker?
Yes, you can use an old Android phone as a GPS tracker. All you need is the right app and configuration. By repurposing your old phone, you can easily turn it into a dedicated GPS tracker without the need for additional hardware.
Can GPS tracker work without a SIM card?
Yes, GPS trackers can work without a SIM card. There are GPS loggers available that only record GPS data. You can later download and view the GPS data by connecting the logger to your computer. These GPS loggers do not actively track real-time location.
Does GPS work without internet?
Yes, GPS works without an internet connection. GPS navigation does not rely on an internet connection but rather on GPS satellites that provide location information to your device. However, for certain features such as map data and points of interest, you may need internet connectivity.
How can I use GPS on my phone without internet?
To use GPS on your phone without internet, follow these steps:
1. Enable the Google Maps Offline feature on your Android or iOS device.
2. Ensure that you are connected to the internet and not in Incognito mode.
3. Open the Google Maps App on your device and go to the Google settings menu.
4. Tap on “Security” and look for the option labeled “Find My Device” or “Find My Phone”. Enable this feature.
What SIM card is needed for a GPS tracker?
For GPS trackers, M2M (Machine-to-Machine) SIM cards are typically used. These SIM cards are designed for devices that need to send and receive data across cellular networks. They provide data connectivity for GPS trackers and allow them to transmit location information.
Is it illegal to track someone with a GPS?
In most cases, it is illegal to track someone with a GPS without their consent. Laws prohibit individuals from using electronic tracking devices to determine the location or movement of a person without proper authorization. There may be exceptions for registered owners, lessors, or lessees of vehicles.
Is it illegal to put a tracker on a phone?
Yes, it is illegal to put a tracker on a phone without proper authorization. It is considered a violation of privacy and can be seen as stalking. Tracking someone’s phone without their consent is generally against the law and can result in legal consequences.
How do I turn my cell phone into a GPS tracker?
To turn your cell phone into a GPS tracker, follow these steps:
1. Open the Settings app on your Android phone.
2. Scroll down and select “Google” or “Google Settings”.
3. In the Google settings menu, tap on “Security”.
4. Look for the option labeled “Find My Device” or “Find My Phone” and enable it.
Can someone track my location with my phone number?
Unfortunately, yes. If someone has access to your phone number, they can track your location. They can use various methods, such as cell tower triangulation or GPS, to determine your exact location. It is difficult to determine if your phone is being tracked or monitored without your knowledge.
Will airplane mode hide my location?
No, airplane mode will not hide your location. If your phone has GPS capabilities, anyone with access to your GPS data can still track your location even if your phone is in airplane mode. To hide your location, you would need to disable the GPS feature on your phone.
Will removing SIM card stop tracking?
Removing the SIM card from your phone will not stop tracking if a GPS tracking device has been installed. GPS tracking devices are separate from the SIM card and rely on GPS satellites to track the device’s location. However, removing the SIM card may affect the device’s ability to transmit location data.
Does Google Maps GPS work without internet?
Yes, Google Maps GPS can work without an internet connection. While certain features, such as real-time information and updates, require an internet connection, the GPS navigation itself does not rely on internet connectivity. GPS satellites provide the location information that is used to plot your location and provide directions.
What is the best offline map for France?
For offline maps in France, you can use mobile mapping apps like Google Maps, Here WeGo, and Navmii. These apps allow you to download maps for offline use, so you don’t need an internet connection to navigate and find your way around. Make sure to download the maps of the specific regions or cities you’ll be visiting in France.
Is there a sat nav for phones that doesn’t use data?
Yes, there are sat nav apps available for phones that don’t require an internet connection or data usage. One example is the Karta GPS app, which allows you to download map files to your phone for offline use. This way, you can navigate and receive turn-by-turn directions without relying on an internet connection.
Is it illegal to track my wife’s phone?
Tracking someone’s phone without their consent, including your spouse’s phone, is generally illegal. It is considered a violation of privacy and can be seen as stalking. It is important to obtain proper authorization and consent before tracking someone’s phone or monitoring their activities.
Is it illegal to secretly track someone?
In many jurisdictions, secretly tracking someone without their consent is illegal. Laws prohibit the use of electronic tracking devices to determine the location or movement of a person without proper authorization. It is important to respect privacy laws and obtain consent before engaging in any

author: admin
title: Heifer International and Alliance of Bioversity and CIAT agree to strengthen collaboration, empower smallholder farmers
text:
Little Rock, AR / Rome, Italy – April 18, 2024 – Heifer International and the Alliance of Bioversity International and the International Center for Tropical Agriculture (CIAT) have agreed to further their shared goals of empowering rural communities, alleviating hunger and poverty, and promoting sustainable agriculture.
Credit: Sylvain Cherkaoui/Heifer International
Little Rock, AR / Rome, Italy – April 18, 2024 – Heifer International and the Alliance of Bioversity International and the International Center for Tropical Agriculture (CIAT) have agreed to further their shared goals of empowering rural communities, alleviating hunger and poverty, and promoting sustainable agriculture.
The two organizations have worked together since 2014, with a focus on developing sustainable agricultural practices that benefit rural women, youth and farming communities worldwide. In a newly signed Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) the partners have established a framework for enhanced collaboration in research, development, capacity building and resource mobilization, to deliver impact to rural smallholder farmers.
“This collaboration marks a significant milestone in our journey toward a more sustainable and equitable future for rural communities,” said Surita Sandosham, CEO and President of Heifer International. “By combining our expertise and resources, we are poised to drive impactful change, fostering resilient agrifood systems, embracing digital innovation, and promoting sustainable practices.”
Through both research and operations, the MoU covers areas of joint technical program work focused on:
Building resilient agrifood systems and boosting climate-smart production, including efforts in crop diversification, agro-ecology and a regenerative approach to soil health and biodiversity, and carbon sequestration, among others. System transformation for smallholders, including sustainable land and water resource management, accessible digital tools for farmers, and sustainable finance. Knowledge management, including impact measuring and modeling.
“Together, we are embarking on a journey to work with rural communities and improve their lives by harnessing the power of science and innovation,” said Juan Lucas Restrepo, Director General of the Alliance of Bioversity and CIAT. “By co-creating solutions with smallholder farmers and for smallholder farmers, we can achieve livelihood and food security and contribute to building food systems that are inclusive, resilient, and respectful of our planet’s natural resources.”
Heifer and the Alliance of Bioversity International and CIAT will also jointly leverage their respective expertise and networks to access the necessary financial resources to fund joint programming.
About Heifer International
Since 1944, Heifer International has worked with more than 46 million people around the world to end hunger and poverty in a sustainable way while caring for the Earth. Heifer currently operates in 19 countries across Africa, Asia, and the Americas, including the United States, supporting farmers and food producers to strengthen local economies and build secure livelihoods that provide a living income. For more information, visit:
About the Alliance of Bioversity International and CIAT
The Alliance of Bioversity International and the International Center for Tropical Agriculture (CIAT) delivers research-based solutions that harness agricultural biodiversity and sustainably transform food systems to improve people’s lives. Alliance solutions address the global crises of malnutrition, climate change, biodiversity loss, and environmental degradation. With novel partnerships, the Alliance generates evidence and mainstreams innovations to transform food systems and landscapes so that they sustain the planet, drive prosperity, and nourish people in a climate crisis. The Alliance is part of CGIAR, a global research partnership for a food-secure future. www.alliancebioversityciat.org

organizations.name: heifer international and alliance of bioversity

author: Shabee Lakehouse
title: Bethlehem cancels Christmas as Israel-Hamas war rages on
text:
The city of Jesus’ birth has canceled its annual Christmas celebrationsa out of respect for the ongoing siege of the Gaza Strip, nearly three months into the war between Israel and Hamas.
Bethlehem – or Beit Lechem, located in what is now the Israeli-occupied West Bank – is typically flooded with pilgrims and other celebrants in late December.
This year, however, the festivities are pared back to a nativity scene at the Evangelical Lutheran Christmas Church of an infant Jesus wrapped in a keffiyeh, surrounded by rubble, NPR reported.
A similar installation will also be placed in Manger Square before Sunday, which is Christmas Eve.
Meanwhile, the Church of the Nativity – which dates back to the sixth century – included razor wire and tarp-wrapped figures in its nativity scene.
The church is practically empty as the usual 6,000 daily visitors that descend on Bethlehem at Christmastime has trickled down to less than 1,000 in one month, the Washington Post reported.
The mournful mood was the joint decision of multiple Palestinian Christian leaders, who came together last month to cancel the public celebrations in light of the war in Gaza.
As a result, the usual parade of 28 Boy Scout troops accompanying the Latin Patriarch’s procession into the city will be reduced to one, silent troop holding Bible verses on peace and possibly photographs of Gazan children, the Washington Post added.
The scaled-down holiday comes just one year after Christmas returned to Bethlehem in full-swing in 2022, following two years of curtailed festivities due to COVID-19.
Christian leaders in Bethlehem have vocally condemned Hamas’ surprise terror attack on Israel on Oct. 7, which killed about 1,200 people and saw at least 240 others taken hostage.
“We condemn the brutal attacks of Hamas on October 7th that caused the loss of life of nearly 1,400 Israelis and citizens of other nations, and we call for the immediate release of all civilians held hostage,” a group of Bethlehem clerics wrote in a letter to President Joe Biden last month.
Hamas’ atrocities, however, did not justify what the group called the “collective violence” against civilians in Gaza, who have now been under siege from Israel’s military for almost three months, the letter read.
“It’s impossible to celebrate when so many — on both sides — have lost so much,” Rami Asakrieh, a Franciscan friar and pastor of St. Catherine’s Church, told the Washington Post this week.
“We canceled the festivities as a sign of solidarity with the victims of the war,” Asakrieh, who signed the letter to Biden, explained.
In his annual Christmas speech, Bethlehem Mayor Hanna Nanania slammed Israel’s retaliatory bombardment of Gaza as “genocide” and “ethnic cleansing,” the Washington Post said.
The head of the local chamber of commerce, Samir Hazboun, also criticized what he called the “moral failure of the West” to curtail the killing of Gazan civilians, the outlet continued.
“If Jesus were born today, he would be born in Gaza amid the rubble,” the Rev. Munther Isaac, pastor of the Evangelical Lutheran Christmas Church, said while standing over his church’s rubble-strewn nativity.
“Who can sing ‘Joy to the World’ today?” he lamented, adding that the story of Jesus’ birth in a stable after his parents – Mary, and her husband Joseph, a Jewish man living under Roman rule – are unable to find lodging is “a story we Palestinians can understand.”
While the usual religious and festive activities have been scaled far back, traditional mass will still be read to mark the major Christian holiday, Asakrieh told the Washington Post.
Washington Post

author: Sandra Loise
title: A tomar precauciones: pronostican fuertes lluvias en los Andes y en la Amazonía para este fin de semana
text:
En el segmento Observatorio del Clima de RPP, el experto en fenómenos naturales
Patricio Valderrama también indicó que las temperaturas mínimas en Lima se mantienen entre 21 y 22 grados.
El geólogo
Patricio Valderrama, expresidente del Servicio Nacional de Meteorología e Hidrología del Perú (Senamhi), pronosticó que se registrarán fuertes lluvias durante este fin de semana en los Andes norte y centrales, así como en la Amazonía sur. Estas precipitaciones ayudarán a llenar los reservorios de agua a nivel nacional, lo que beneficiará a la agricultura y el consumo humano.
En el segmento Observatorio del Clima de RPP,
Patricio Valderrama prevé que, para los siguientes tres días, las lluvias van a continuar en la sierra de Piura y Lambayeque, también en Áncash y en las partes andinas de Lima e Ica.
“Hemos tenido fuertes lluvias en el norte del Perú, también en la parte central y en los Andes sur. Más o menos el panorama que tenemos a futuro para los siguientes días es que las lluvias van a continuar en la sierra de Piura, Lambayeque, en Áncash y en las partes andinas de la región Lima e Ica. Las regiones de Pasco, Junín, Ayacucho y Apurímac, donde tenemos bastante probabilidad de tener lluvias intensas por los siguientes tres días”, dijo el especialista.
https://rpp.pe/noticias/patricio-valderrama?ref=rpp advirtió que también se registrarán fuertes lluvias en las regiones amazónicas de Madre de Dios, Pucallpa y Loreto, durante los próximos tres días, por lo que hizo un llamado a la población para tomar las precauciones del caso.
“Hay que tener una precaución especial en las regiones amazónicas Madre de Dios, Pucallpa y Loreto van a volver a tener grandes lluvias este fin de semana, los próximos tres días, principalmente en Madre de Dios, Puerto Maldonado, porque hay un fuerte de lluvias entrando desde Bolivia. Entonces vamos a tener un fin de semana bastante lluvioso”, añadió.
Temperaturas en Lima
https://rpp.pe/noticias/patricio-valderrama?ref=rpp indicó que las temperaturas mínimas en Lima se mantienen entre 21 y 22 grados. Asimismo, pronosticó que conforme vayan avanzando las semanas, las temperaturas irán descendiendo progresivamente.,
“Todo indica que para la segunda semana de abril ya vamos a tener una sensación de frío y humedad considerable en la capital. Nada parecido al otoño del año pasado, que cuando recién estaba gestando El Niño, estábamos en un evento muy caluroso atmosféricamente”, indicó.
Situación en el sur
El experto advirtió que ya se está comenzando a notar un descenso de las temperaturas en los Andes sur, principalmente en las zonas que están por encima de los 3 mil metros sobre el nivel del mar.
“Cusco está amaneciendo con 6 grados, Abancay con 9, Arequipa ciudad con 13, Sicuani con 6, Juliaca con 6. Entonces ya hay que comenzar a tomar precauciones, sobre todo con los más chicos que se preparan para ir al colegio, hora de la temperatura mínima, entre las 5 y 7 de la mañana”, puntualizó.
Te recomendamos
Elmer Huerta tendrá letra de médico pero te habla en sencillo. A través de este podcast el asesor médico de RPP aborda de manera clara y concisa temas de salud, investigación y actualidad médica. Se convertirá sin duda en tu médico de cabecera.
Comparte esta noticia
